author: Herald Staff
title: Dazzling Jules
text:
Wide receiver Julian Edelman is averaging 10 receptions per game through the Patriots’ first three games of the season. If he maintains that pace today against the Cowboys, Edelman would tie the league record for the most catches through four games — a mark set by Wes Welker, his predecessor as the Patriots’ slot receiver.
Here’s a look at the current top 10 for receptions through the first four games of an NFL season:
Player Team Year No.
1. Wes Welker Patriots 2011 40
2.T.J. Houshmandzadeh Bengals 2007 39
3. Julio Jones Falcons 2015 38
4. Terance Mathis Falcons 1994 36
Eric Metcalf Falcons 1995 36
J.T. Smith Cardinals 1989 36
Jimmy Smith Jaguars 2000 36
Rod Smith Broncos 2001 36
9. Lionel Taylor Broncos 1961 35
10. Antonio Brown Steelers 2015 34
Julian Edelman Patriots 2013 34
Andre Johnson Texans 2013 34
Jerry Rice 49ers 1995 34
Steve Smith Giants 2009 34
JULIAN EDELMAN *Patriots 2015 30
*—Through three games
-TEXT/STAFF GRAPHIC BY NATE DOW / SOURCE: PRO-FOOTBALL-REFERENCE.COM
